member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys authentication configurations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Helpers.GetChunkHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: A private utility routine to convert an integer to a chunk header, which is an ASCII hex number followed by a CRLF.The header is returned as a byte array. Generates a right-aligned hex string and returns the start offset.
member.param: Chunk size to be encoded
member.returns: A byte array with the header in int.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel
member.summary: Enum declaring the allowed values for the verbosity level when http.sys reject requests due to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Basic
member.summary: A 503 response is not sent; the connection is reset. This is the default HTTP Server API behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Limited
member.summary: The HTTP Server API sends a 503 response with a "Service Unavailable" reason phrase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Full
member.summary: The HTTP Server API sends a 503 response with a detailed reason phrase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysDefaults.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: The name of the authentication scheme used.

member.summary: Start accepting incoming requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener.Dispose
member.summary: Stop the server and clean up.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener.AcceptAsync
member.summary: Accept a request from the incoming request queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxAccepts
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent accepts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.EnableResponseCaching
member.summary: Attempts kernel mode caching for responses with eligible headers. The response may not include Set-Cookie, Vary, or Pragma headers. It must include a Cache-Control header with Public and either a Shared-Max-Age or Max-Age value, or an Expires header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.UrlPrefixes
member.summary: The url prefixes to register with Http.Sys. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Authentication
member.summary: Http.Sys authentication settings. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Timeouts
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys timeout configurations. These may also be configured in the registry. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.ThrowWriteExceptions
member.summary: Gets or Sets if response body writes that fail due to client disconnects should throw exceptions or complete normally. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections to accept, -1 for infinite, or null to use the machine wide setting from the registry. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.RequestQueueLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of requests that will be queued up in Http.Sys.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxRequestBodySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size of any request body in bytes. When set to null, the maximum request body size is unlimited. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .
member.remarks: Defaults to 30,000,000 bytes, which is approximately 28.6MB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.AllowSynchronousIO
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether synchronous IO is allowed for the HttpContext.Request.Body and HttpContext.Response.Body. The default is `true`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Http503Verbosity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls how http.sys reacts when rejecting requests due to throttling conditions - like when the request queue limit is reached. The default in http.sys is "Basic" which means http.sys is just resetting the TCP connection. IIS uses Limited as its default behavior which will result in sending back a 503 - Service Unavailable back to the client.

member.summary: Enable kernel caching for the response with the given timeout. Http.Sys determines if the response can be cached.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Response.HasStarted
member.summary: Indicates if the response status, reason, and headers are prepared to send and can no longer be modified. This is caused by the first write or flush to the response body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys timeout configurations. These may also be configured in the registry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.EntityBody
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the request entity body to arrive. The default timer is 2 minutes.
The HTTP Server API turns on this timer when the request has an entity body. The timer expiration is initially set to the configured value. When the HTTP Server API receives additional data indications on the request, it resets the timer to give the connection another interval.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.DrainEntityBody
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to drain the entity body on a Keep-Alive connection. The default timer is 2 minutes.
On a Keep-Alive connection, after the application has sent a response for a request and before the request entity body has completely arrived, the HTTP Server API starts draining the remainder of the entity body to reach another potentially pipelined request from the client. If the time to drain the remaining entity body exceeds the allowed period the connection is timed out.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.RequestQueue
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the request to remain in the request queue before the application picks it up. The default timer is 2 minutes.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.IdleConnection
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for an idle connection. The default timer is 2 minutes.
This timeout is only enforced after the first request on the connection is routed to the application.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.HeaderWait
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to parse the request header. The default timer is 2 minutes.
This timeout is only enforced after the first request on the connection is routed to the application.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.MinSendBytesPerSecond
member.summary:
The minimum send rate, in bytes-per-second, for the response. The default response send rate is 150 bytes-per-second.
Use 0 to indicate that system defaults should be used.
To disable this timer set it to UInt32.MaxValue

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.UrlPrefix.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa364698(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: http or https. Will be normalized to lower case.
+, *, IPv4, [IPv6], or a dns name. Http.Sys does not permit punycode (xn--), use Unicode instead.
If empty, the default port for the given scheme will be used (80 or 443).
Should start and end with a '/', though a missing trailing slash will be added. This value must be un-escaped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.UrlPrefix.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa364698(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: http or https. Will be normalized to lower case.
+, *, IPv4, [IPv6], or a dns name. Http.Sys does not permit punycode (xn--), use Unicode instead.
If empty, the default port for the given scheme will be used (80 or 443).
Should start and end with a '/', though a missing trailing slash will be added. This value must be un-escaped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.DecodeCore(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char
The place to write to
The end of the buffer
The byte array

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.UnescapePercentEncoding(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the buffer
The byte array
member.returns: The unescaped byte if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.ReadHex(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The iterator will be moved to the next byte no matter no matter whether the operation successes.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the buffer
The byte array
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.
